tags.description: Use helper calls to get information necessary to create an API client.
tags.name: Helper

tags.description: Manage API clients for the account.
tags.name: API clients

get.description: This operation lists API clients an administrator can manage on the current account or other managed accounts using the `accountSwitchKey` parameter.

parameters.description: Includes actions you can perform on the object, `false` by default.
parameters.name: actions

example.clientDescription: Provides access to the reporting data.

accessToken.description: Part of the client secret that identifies your API client and lets you access applications and resources. It helps form the unique hostname the client uses to call the API. Tokens are unique per client.

actions.description: Specifies activities available for the API client.

deactivateAll.description: Whether you can deactivate the API client's credentials.

delete.description: Whether you can remove the API client.

edit.description: Whether you can update the API client.

lock.description: Whether you can lock the API client.

transfer.description: Whether you can transfer the API client to a new owner.

unlock.description: Whether you can unlock the API client.

activeCredentialCount.description: Number of credentials active for the API client. When the count is zero, you can delete the API client without interruption.

allowAccountSwitch.description: Whether the API client can manage more than one account. For details, see [Manage many accounts with one API client](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client).

canAutoCreateCredential.description: Whether the API client can create a credential for a new API client.

clientDescription.description: Descriptive label about the API client.

clientId.description: Unique identifier for each API client.

clientName.description: Descriptive label for the API client.

clientType.description: Specifies the API client's ownership and credential management. `CLIENT` indicates the creator owns and manages the credentials. `USER_CLIENT` indicates another user owns the client and manages the credentials. `SERVICE_ACCOUNT` indicates only `authorizedUsers` can manage the client's credentials. The default is `CLIENT`.

createdBy.description: The user who created the API client.

createdDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the API client was created.

isLocked.description: Whether the user's account is locked. To learn more, see [Temporary account lockout](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam/docs/tmp-account-lockout).

notificationEmails.description: Email addresses to notify users of expiring credentials.

serviceConsumerToken.description: Unique identifier for the service hostname.

200.description: The response provides a list of API clients an administrator can manage.

post.description: This operation creates a new API client. Optionally, you can automatically assign a credential for the client when you create it. If you choose not to assign the credential automatically, see [Create authentication credentials](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/set-up-authentication-credentials) for details.

example.clientDescription: Provides access to the reporting data.

allowAccountSwitch.description: Enables the API client to manage more than one account. For details, see [Manage many accounts with one API client](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client).

apiAccess.description: The APIs the API client can access.

allAccessibleApis.description: Enables the API client to access a full set of available APIs. Note there's a limit of 99 API services for each client. Clients that make calls to URLs from the 100th service get a 403 error.
Enables the API client to access a full set of available APIs. Note there's a limit of 99 API services for each client. Clients that make calls to URLs from the 100th service get a 403 error.
Enables the API client to access a full set of available APIs. Note there's a limit of 99 API services for each client. Clients that make calls to URLs from the 100th service get a 403 error.

apis.description: Set of APIs the API client can access when `allAccessibleApis` is disabled. To get this data, run the [List allowed APIs](ref:get-api-clients-users-allowed-apis) operation.

accessLevel.description: The API client's access level on a per API basis, either `READ-ONLY` or `READ-WRITE`.

apiId.description: Unique identifier for each API. To get this value, run the [List allowed APIs](ref:get-api-clients-users-allowed-apis) operation.

documentationUrl.description: Link to more information about the API.

endPoint.description: Specifies where the API can access resources.

authorizedUsers.description: The API client's valid users. When the `clientType` is either `CLIENT` or `USER_CLIENT`, you need to specify a single `username` in the array. To get this data, run the [List authorized users](ref:get-api-clients-users) operation.

canAutoCreateCredential.description: Whether the API client can create a credential for a new API client. The default is `false`.

clientDescription.description: Descriptive label about the API client.

clientName.description: Descriptive label for the API client.

clientType.description: Specifies the API client's ownership and credential management. `CLIENT` indicates the creator owns and manages the credentials. `USER_CLIENT` indicates another user owns the client and manages the credentials.

createCredential.description: With `canAutoCreateCredential` enabled, setting this to `true` creates new credentials along with a new API client. The default is `false`.

groupAccess.description: Specifies the API client's group access.

cloneAuthorizedUserGroups.description: Sets the API client's group access the same as the authorized user. Set it to `false` and specify the access in the `groups` array.

groups.description: Groups the API client can access. To get this data, run the [List accessible groups](ref:get-api-clients-users-group-access) operation.

items.description: Groups the API client can access.

groupId.description: Unique identifier for each group. To get this value, run the [List accessible groups](ref:get-api-clients-users-group-access) operation.

isBlocked.description: Blocks the API client access to the group's child groups.

parentGroupId.description: Unique identifier for the parent group within the group tree. If you're viewing group info for a root-level group, you may not see this member.

roleDescription.description: Descriptive label for the role to convey its use.

roleId.description: Unique identifier for each role. To get this value, run the [List roles](ref:get-roles) operation.

subGroups.description: Children of the parent group. Permissions cascade downward from parent to child unless the child group's `isBlocked` is `true`.

cloneAuthorizedUserGroups.description: Set it to `true` to clone the API client's group access from the authorized user.

groups.description: Groups the API client can access. To get this data, run the [List accessible groups](ref:get-api-clients-users-group-access) operation.

items.description: Groups the API client can access.

groupId.description: Unique identifier for each group. To get this value, run the [List accessible groups](ref:get-api-clients-users-group-access) operation.

isBlocked.description: Blocks the API client access to the group's child groups.

parentGroupId.description: Unique identifier for the parent group within the group tree. If you're viewing group info for a root-level group, you may not see this member.

roleDescription.description: Descriptive label for the role to convey its use.

roleId.description: Unique identifier for each role. To get this value, run the [List roles](ref:get-roles) operation.

subGroups.description: Children of the parent group. Permissions cascade downward from parent to child unless the child group's `isBlocked` is `true`.

ipAcl.description: Specifies the API client's IP list restriction.

cidr.description: IP addresses or CIDR blocks the API client can access.

enable.description: Enables API client's access to the IP ACL.

notificationEmails.description: Email addresses to notify users of expiring credentials.

purgeOptions.description: Configures the API client for access to the [Fast Purge API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/purge-cache/reference/api). Provide it only if the `apis` object includes an `apiName` of `CCU APIs`.

canPurgeByCacheTag.description: Whether the API client can purge content by cache tag.

canPurgeByCpcode.description: Whether the API client can purge content by CP code.

cpcodeAccess.description: CP codes the API client can purge.

allCurrentAndNewCpcodes.description: Whether the API client can purge content by cache tag.

cpcodes.description: CP codes the API client can purge. To get these values, run the [List allowed CP codes](ref:post-api-clients-users-allowed-cpcodes) operation.

delete.description: This operation permanently deletes an API client you own, without active credentials. It also breaks any API connections with the client. Before deleting your API client, deactivate all credentials and make sure there aren't any API integrations or scripts using them.

client-id-path.description: Unique identifier for each API client. To get this value, run the [List API clients](ref:get-api-clients) operation.
client-id-path.name: clientId

username-path.description: Unique username for each user. To get this value, run the [List authorized users](ref:get-api-clients-users) operation.
username-path.name: username

client-type-query.description: Filters data by client type, either `USER_CLIENT`, `SERVICE_ACCOUNT`, or default `CLIENT`.
client-type-query.name: clientType

allow-account-switch-query.description: Includes account a user can switch to, `false` by default.
allow-account-switch-query.name: allowAccountSwitch

accessToken.description: Part of the client secret that identifies your API client and lets you access applications and resources. It helps form the unique hostname the client uses to call the API. Tokens are unique per client.

actions.description: Specifies activities available for the API client.

deactivateAll.description: Whether you can deactivate the API client's credentials.

delete.description: Whether you can remove the API client.

edit.description: Whether you can update the API client.

lock.description: Whether you can lock the API client.

transfer.description: Whether you can transfer the API client to a new owner.

unlock.description: Whether you can unlock the API client.

activeCredentialCount.description: Number of credentials active for the API client. When the count is zero, you can delete the API client without interruption.

allowAccountSwitch.description: Whether the API client can manage more than one account. For details, see [Manage many accounts with one API client](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client).

canAutoCreateCredential.description: Whether the API client can create a credential for a new API client.

clientDescription.description: Descriptive label about the API client.

clientId.description: Unique identifier for each API client.

clientName.description: Descriptive label for the API client.

clientType.description: Specifies the API client's ownership and credential management. `CLIENT` indicates the creator owns and manages the credentials. `USER_CLIENT` indicates another user owns the client and manages the credentials. `SERVICE_ACCOUNT` indicates only `authorizedUsers` can manage the client's credentials. The default is `CLIENT`.

createdBy.description: The user who created the API client.

createdDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the API client was created.

isLocked.description: Whether the user's account is locked. To learn more, see [Temporary account lockout](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam/docs/tmp-account-lockout).

notificationEmails.description: Email addresses to notify users of expiring credentials.

serviceConsumerToken.description: Unique identifier for the service hostname.
